abstract.p: Quiz on places described in song and verse (The Sophisticated Traveler, part 2 of 2 part section)

block.p: Where the remote----- ride In th' ocean's bosom unespy'd: Andrew Marvell
Open my heart, and you will see, Graved inside of it ''-----'': Robert Browning
We open in -----, we next play -----, then on to -----: Cole Porter
I'm in a ------ state of mind: Billy Joel
From ----- icy mountains, From ------ Coral strand: Reginald Heber
When ----- first, at Heaven's command, Arose from out the azure main: James Thompson
Mademoiselle from -----, parley-voo?: Anonymous
There was a youg belle of old ----- Whose garments were always in patchez: Ogden Nash
Let observation with extensive view, Survey mankind, from ----- to ------: Samuel Johnson
If you want to know who we are, We are gentlemen of -----: William S. Gilbert
O -----, isn't it grand you look, Like a bride in her rich adormin'?: John Locke
The last time I saw -----, her heart was warm and gay: Oscar Hammerstein II
Fair -----! Sad relic of departed worth!: Lord Byron
The outlook wasn't brilliant for the ----- nine that day; The score stood four to two, with but one inning more to play: Ernest Laurence Thayer
Wish they all could be ----- girls: The Beach Boys
There was a young lady of -----, Who smiled as she rode on a tiger: Anonymous

Answers: Marvell: Bermudas Browning: Italy Porter: Venice, Verona, Cremona Joel: New York Heber: Greenland's, India's Thomson: Britain Anonymous: Armentieres Nash: Natchez Johnson: China, Peru Gilbert: Japan Locke: Ireland Hammerstein: Paris Byron: Greece Thayer: Mudville Beach Boys: California Anonymous: Niger
